sub_topic: Finding the maximum or minimum value of a trigonometric function
message_1: A student wants to find the maximum value of the function f(x) = 2sin(x) + 3cos(x) in the interval [0,π]. Can you help the student to find the maximum value?
message_2:
Yes, I can help the student find the maximum value of the function f(x) = 2sin(x) + 3cos(x) in the interval [0,π].

To find the maximum value of the function, we can use the following formula:

max_value = √(a² + b²)

where a and b are the coefficients of sin(x) and cos(x) respectively.

In this case, a = 2 and b = 3. So,

max_value = √(2² + 3²) = √(4 + 9) = √13

Therefore, the maximum value of the function f(x) = 2sin(x) + 3cos(x) in the interval [0,π] is √13.
